alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:57PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook and east central Penobscot Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 855 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Medway, or 10 miles east of Millinocket, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... East Millinocket, Medway, Wytopitlock, Reed Plantation, Mattawamkeag, Chester, Winn, Woodville, Kingman, Reed, Macwahoc, Bancroft, Glenwood, Silver Ridge, Drew Plantation, Molunkus, Monarda, Benedicta and Grindstone. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 238 and 257. State Highway 11 between East Millinocket and Medway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook
